definitions: relating to the universe or cosmos, especially as distinct from earth
immeasurably vast, significant, or awe-inspiring in scale or importance
examples: Cosmic radiation bombards Earth constantly from deep space
Scientists study cosmic dust to understand star formation
The discovery had cosmic implications for human understanding
Their argument seemed trivial against cosmic timescales

definitions: relating to the scientific study of the origin and structure of the universe
examples: The cosmological constant puzzles theoretical physicists today
Cosmological models attempt to explain universal expansion

definitions: familiar with and at ease in many different countries and cultures
containing people from many different countries; international in character
examples: Her cosmopolitan outlook came from years of international travel
The restaurant offers cosmopolitan cuisine from five continents
New York remains one of the world's most cosmopolitan cities
The university attracts a cosmopolitan student body

definitions: costing a lot of money; expensive to buy or maintain
causing suffering, loss, or disadvantage through being expensive in consequences
examples: The renovation proved more costly than originally estimated
Medical procedures can be extremely costly without insurance
His costly mistake resulted in the company losing millions
The war became increasingly costly in human lives

definitions: dressed in a costume, especially for a performance or special occasion
examples: Costumed performers entertained children at the birthday party
The costumed actors rehearsed their historical reenactment

definitions: giving a feeling of comfort, warmth, and relaxation in a small space
suggesting an excessively close or collusive relationship between people
examples: The cottage had a cosy living room with a fireplace
We spent a cosy evening reading by the fire
Politicians maintained cosy relationships with corporate lobbyists
The cosy arrangement between competitors raised antitrust concerns

definitions: able to be counted; denoting a noun that can form plurals and be used with numerals
examples: In English grammar, 'book' is a countable noun
Stars in our galaxy are countable but extremely numerous

definitions: moving or acting in the opposite direction or manner
contrary to or in conflict with something
examples: The counter current made swimming difficult
Counter forces acted upon the moving object
His views ran counter to prevailing opinion
The decision was counter to their interests

definitions: having an equal and opposite force or influence that creates equilibrium
examples: The design features counterbalanced weights for smooth operation
Her pessimism was counterbalanced by his optimism

definitions: moving in a direction opposite to the movement of clock hands when viewed from above
examples: Turn the screw counterclockwise to loosen it
The hurricane rotated in a counterclockwise direction

definitions: relating to or expressing what has not happened or is not the case
examples: Historians sometimes engage in counterfactual speculation about events
The counterfactual scenario assumes different initial conditions

definitions: made in exact imitation of something valuable with the intention to deceive
examples: Police seized thousands of counterfeit twenty-dollar bills
The counterfeit designer handbags looked remarkably authentic

definitions: contrary to what one would intuitively expect or what seems to be common sense
examples: The counterintuitive solution actually proved most effective
Quantum mechanics presents many counterintuitive phenomena

definitions: too many to be counted; very many in number
examples: She received countless letters of support from fans
Countless stars filled the clear night sky

definitions: extending throughout a nation; affecting or covering an entire country
examples: The company launched a countrywide advertising campaign
Countrywide protests erupted after the announcement

definitions: extending throughout a county; affecting or covering an entire county
examples: The sheriff won the countywide election by a large margin
They implemented countywide water restrictions during drought

definitions: connected or combined together, especially in a pair or series
examples: The coupled train cars traveled across the country
These factors, coupled with poor weather, caused delays

definitions: not deterred by danger or pain; showing bravery in facing difficulty
examples: The firefighter's courageous actions saved three lives
She made a courageous decision to speak the truth

definitions: polite, respectful, and considerate in manner toward others
examples: The staff provided courteous service throughout our stay
He remained courteous despite the customer's complaints

definitions: very polite and refined, as befitting a royal court; showing formal elegance
examples: He greeted her with a courtly bow
The ambassador maintained courtly manners throughout dinner

definitions: having something on top or in front as protection or concealment
protected by insurance or included in the scope of something
examples: The covered bridge protected travelers from rain
Snow covered mountains stretched into the distance
Your medical expenses are fully covered by insurance
All topics covered in class will appear on the exam

definitions: not openly acknowledged or displayed; secret or hidden from view
examples: The agency conducted covert surveillance operations
She stole covert glances at him during the meeting

definitions: greatly desired or sought after by many people; highly prized
examples: She won the coveted award for best actress
The coveted position attracted hundreds of applicants

definitions: lacking courage to face danger, difficulty, or pain; showing fear
examples: The cowardly attack targeted innocent civilians
His cowardly behavior disappointed his teammates

definitions: making a pretense of shyness to be alluring; acting demure
reluctant to give details about something; evasive in an irritating way
examples: She gave him a coy smile from across the room
The actress played coy about her romantic life
The company remained coy about its future plans
He was coy when asked about his intentions

definitions: giving a feeling of comfort, warmth, and relaxation in a small space
suggesting an excessively close or collusive relationship between people
examples: The cabin offered a cozy retreat from winter cold
They found a cozy corner in the coffee shop
Critics questioned the cozy relationship between regulators and banks
The cozy arrangement benefited both parties

definitions: of the highest excellence or skill; first-rate in ability
examples: The crack troops led the military operation
She's a crack shot with a rifle

definitions: having lines of breakage without coming apart; damaged with fissures
mentally unbalanced or crazy in an eccentric way
examples: The cracked windshield needed immediate replacement
Her cracked lips showed signs of dehydration
People thought his cracked ideas would never work
The old hermit seemed a bit cracked to visitors

definitions: mentally unbalanced; crazy or mad in an informal British sense
examples: You must be crackers to attempt that dangerous stunt
The whole idea sounds absolutely crackers to me

definitions: excellent in quality; very good or enjoyable; proceeding at great speed
examples: That was a cracking good match last night
We set off at a cracking pace this morning

definitions: clever at achieving aims by indirect or deceitful methods; sly and cunning
examples: The crafty politician avoided answering difficult questions
Foxes have a reputation for being crafty animals

definitions: having a rough, uneven surface with many projections; rugged with steep rocks
examples: His craggy face showed years of outdoor living
The craggy mountains rose dramatically from the valley

definitions: uncomfortably small or restricted in size, lacking adequate space
unable to move freely due to lack of space or stiffness
examples: The cramped apartment barely fit their furniture
Students complained about cramped dormitory conditions
My legs felt cramped after the long flight
Her cramped handwriting was difficult to read

definitions: relating to the skull or cranium; of or concerning the brain case
examples: The cranial nerves control various sensory functions
Doctors examined the cranial cavity for injuries

definitions: having eccentric or strange ideas; irritable and bad-tempered
examples: His crank theories about aliens amused his friends
The crank old man yelled at neighborhood children

definitions: bad-tempered, irritable, and complaining; easily annoyed or made angry
examples: The baby gets cranky when she's tired
He was cranky all morning before his coffee

definitions: complete and humiliating in degree; used for emphasis of something negative
examples: The party was a crashing bore from start to finish
His crashing ignorance of basic facts shocked everyone

definitions: lacking sensitivity, refinement, or intelligence; crude and showing no understanding
examples: His crass comments offended everyone at the dinner
The movie's crass humor appealed to teenage audiences

definitions: wanted or desired intensely; longed for with great intensity
examples: The craved recognition finally came after years
She ordered the craved chocolate cake for dessert

definitions: contemptibly lacking in courage; cowardly in a particularly shameful way
examples: His craven surrender disappointed his supporters
The craven decision to abandon allies shocked observers

definitions: wildly insane or excited; driven to madness or frenzy
having a network of fine cracks on the surface
examples: The crazed gunman was subdued by police
Crazed fans rushed toward the stage
The crazed glaze on ancient pottery adds character
The old painting showed crazed varnish

definitions: mentally deranged or insane; showing wild or aggressive behavior
extremely enthusiastic about or infatuated with someone or something
absurd, ridiculous, or wildly impractical in nature
examples: The crazy man shouted at invisible enemies
That crazy driver nearly caused an accident
She's crazy about Italian food and wine
He went crazy when his team won
That's a crazy idea that will never work
The crazy weather changed three times today

definitions: resembling cream in consistency, color, or taste; smooth and rich
containing cream or having cream added; made with cream
examples: The soup had a creamy texture without dairy
She chose a creamy beige paint for walls
The creamy pasta sauce contained heavy cream
This creamy dessert melts in your mouth

definitions: having the ability to create original ideas or things using imagination
relating to or involving the use of imagination to produce something
examples: Her creative solutions impressed the entire team
Creative people often see connections others miss
The creative process requires both inspiration and discipline
She works in the creative department

definitions: able to be believed or trusted; convincing and seeming reasonable or probable
examples: The witness provided credible testimony in court
Scientists found credible evidence supporting the theory

definitions: deserving public acknowledgment and praise but not necessarily outstanding
examples: The team achieved a creditable third place finish
Her creditable performance earned modest praise

definitions: given recognition for an achievement or contribution; attributed as the source
examples: She was credited with discovering the new element
The credited author disputed the article's claims

definitions: causing an unpleasant feeling of fear or unease; disturbing
strange or weird in a way that makes one uncomfortable
examples: The creepy house stood abandoned for decades
That creepy noise kept me awake all night
His creepy smile made everyone uncomfortable
The movie had a creepy atmosphere throughout

definitions: gradually increasing in loudness, intensity, or force toward a climax
examples: The crescendo passage built to a dramatic climax
Public criticism reached a crescendo point yesterday

definitions: having the curved shape of the moon in its first or last quarter
examples: The crescent moon hung low in the evening sky
She wore a crescent shaped pendant
